paper.title: A simpler construction of CCA2-secure public-key encryption under general assumptions

author.org: IBM T.J. Watson, Hawthorne, New York#TAB#

paper.venue: Theory and Application of Cryptographic Techniques
paper.abstract: In this paper we present a simpler construction of a publickey encryption scheme that achieves adaptive chosen ciphertext security (CCA2), assuming the existence of trapdoor permutations. We build on previous works of Sahai and De Santis et al. and construct a scheme that we believe is the easiest to understand to date. In particular, it is only slightly more involved than the Naor-Yung encryption scheme that is secure against passive chosen-ciphertext attacks (CCA1). We stress that the focus of this paper is on simplicity only.
